image.altText: A man and a woman smile with their arms interlinked.

props.synopsis: Jenn Arnold knew her partner Stephen wanted his organs donated in the event of a tragedy, because they discussed it before he died in a car accident. She says more people should discuss their donation status this DonateLife week.

title.children: When Jenn's partner died in a car accident, donating his organs was a 'tangible good in the saddest of times'

image.altText: The exterior of the court, showing the sign and the crest.

props.synopsis: A Canberra tradie is denied bail for allegedly repeatedly hitting a client who recorded their conversation about defects in work done on his house, before hitting him with his ute.

title.children: Canberra tradie behind bars after allegedly assaulting dissatisfied client and hitting him with his ute

image.altText: The outside of a courthouse with letters on the facade that read "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The 30-year-old Canberra man was denied bail after he allegedly kicked his partner, who is seven months pregnant, in the stomach just hours after a family violence order had been imposed.

title.children: Canberra man behind bars for allegedly kicking heavily pregnant partner in the stomach

image.altText: Finances generic

props.synopsis: Australia's annual rate of inflation lifted to 3.8 per cent in the June quarter, up from 3.6 per cent.

title.children: Inflation up but drop in RBA's 'core' target is 'good news' on possible rate rise

image.altText: Amanda Rishworth standing at a podium with a microphone, talking to the media, wearing a pink jacket

props.synopsis: The federal government has revealed its response to the landmark disability royal commission, but has not committed to a number of the most contentious recommendations.

title.children: After years of 'harrowing evidence', the federal government has responded to the disability royal commission

image.altText: The Milky Way appears in a dark night sky as a band of bright stars and clouds. Several people are on the ground taking photos.

props.synopsis: Most people in the world live under light-polluted skies. Our interactives show you how even simple changes can bring the stars back into view.

title.children: When was the last time you saw the Milky Way? See how your view is affected by 'sky glow'

image.altText: Australian swimmer Kaylee McKeown smiles on pooldeck as she wears her gold medal and holds a box and a toy kangaroo.

props.synopsis: After defending her 100m backstroke title and setting a new Olympic record, Kaylee McKeown pays a heartfelt tribute to her father, who died in 2020.

title.children: 'He was with me tonight': McKeown pays tribute to late father after historic gold

image.altText: A Rex Airlines plane stands on a runway.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines, Australia's largest regional and domestic airline operator, enters administration, with domestic 737 services grounded and up to 610 workers expected to lose their jobs.

title.children: Up to 610 workers expected to lose jobs as Rex Airlines enters voluntary administration

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a purple background with the words "Team Trump".

props.synopsis: The director of the "Project 2025" plan for a Donald Trump presidency steps down after Democrats made attacking it central to their election campaign and Trump repeatedly distanced himself from it.

title.children: Project 2025 director ends work on plan for Trump presidency after continued attack from Democrats

image.altText: A concrete building is damaged and crumbling after an apparent air attack

props.synopsis: Israel's air force says its air strike targeted Muhsin Shukr, also known as Fuad Shukr, who it believes was responsible for ordering an attack on Golan Heights that left 12 people dead at the weekend.

title.children: IDF says it has killed 'Hezbollah's most senior military commander' in air strike on Beirut

image.altText: QH artwork

props.synopsis: An Olympic star makes an incredible pregnancy reveal shortly after competing, a gold medallist's moment ruined by overzealous photographers, and Coco Gauff's Olympic dream ends in tears after an umpire run-in. Here are some moments you may have missed overnight in Paris.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: An incredible pregnancy reveal, a gold medal moment ruined by photographers, and Coco Gauff's tearful exit

image.altText: A close-up shot of a shopping trolley full of groceries in a supermarket with a woman behind bagging apples.

props.synopsis: Inflation rises 3.8 per cent in year to June in line with economists' expectations. Follow live.

title.children: Inflation rises 3.8 per cent in year to June

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: What does this mean for interest rates?
Consumer prices rise 3.8 per cent over the year to June

image.altText: Faith Nathan and Teagan Levi hug on the pitch while on their haunches

props.synopsis: Australia's brilliant campaign in the women's rugby sevens looked on track to deliver gold but ended in heartbreak. This is how a few tiny errors ended up in Olympic heartbreak.

title.children: How Australia's rugby sevens golden dream turned to a nightmare

image.altText: A composite image of three young girls, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Taylor Swift pays tribute to the children killed and injured in a stabbing attack at a dance class being held to her music on Monday, saying she's "completely in shock", as the death toll from the incident rises.

title.children: Taylor Swift pays tribute to children killed in UK stabbing attack at dance class as death toll rises

image.altText: A doctor gives Hunter a spoonful of puree with peanut powder in it.

props.synopsis: Babies with a peanut allergy will be offered oral immunotherapy in Australia for the first time as part of a new standardised model of care in hospitals across the country.

title.children: Peanut allergies in babies to be treated for the first time under national model of care

image.altText: Sharon Firisua iwinim gold long 10,000 metre long Samoa (Samoa Pac Games)

props.synopsis: One of only two Solomon Islands athletes at the Paris games, marathon runner Sharon Firisua was offered the country's wildcard spot in the flagship 100m heats, which kick off on Friday night.

title.children: Marathon runner picked for Olympic 100m sprints, as administrators question 'unbelievable' decision

image.altText: An altered image shows an elderly man with a dark moustache with his eyes covered by a black streak and an aircraft behind.

props.synopsis: Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada, the alleged co-founder of the notorious Sinaloa Cartel, evaded US authorities for decades. Last week, they got their man, but exactly how the controversial arrest went down depends on who you talk to.

title.children: The private jet, the drug lord's son, and the 'kidnap' plot that blindsided an alleged cartel kingpin

image.altText: A Hungarian boxer in blue and an Australian boxer in red look agitated as they punch each other in the face.

props.synopsis: Harry Garside's Olympics boxing loss demonstrates in an acutely memorable way just how costly it can be for a human being to devote everything in their power to a specific endeavour and not succeed.

title.children: The ringside interview that seemed more painful than being punched in the face, and taught us a lesson about failure

image.altText: A woman soccer player wearing yellow kicks a ball during a game

props.synopsis: Planning your Olympic viewing for tonight? Here's what's happening on day five of the Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day five: Swimming, hockey, canoe slalom and a must-win match for the Matildas

image.altText: Simone Biles after finishing her routine

props.synopsis: Three years after she missed the same event with the "twisties", Simone Biles has helped the USA win gold in the artistic gymnastics women's team final in Paris.

title.children: Simone Biles breaks US Olympic record with another gold

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown smiles widely while holding her gold medal

props.synopsis: Two months ago Kaylee McKeown was the world record holder in the 100m backstroke, before having it whipped away from her by Regan Smith — but this race proved once again that it's the timing that counts at the Olympic Games.

title.children: An American came for McKeown's crown — but the Aussie legend showed the Olympics is all about timing

image.altText: A woman wearing a protective mask walks with a bike in China.

props.synopsis: The Pathway to Clean Indoor Air in Victoria could speed up the end of the current pandemic and help us prepare for the next one. But improving indoor air quality won't just bring health benefits — it could also boost businesses' bottom lines.

title.children: We've cleaned our drinking water for decades. Why don't we do the same with the air we breathe?

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a dark blazer answers questions from a reporter in a corridor.

props.synopsis: Australian politicians have taken aim at Qantas over Rex Airlines' downfall but an aviation analyst says the regional carrier is to blame.

title.children: Qantas has 'enacted retribution' on Rex Airlines, shadow transport minister says

image.altText: A woman wearing  a hijab is shown from behind, she also wears a Palestinian scarf.

props.synopsis: As the Albanese government mulls over its special envoy to combat Islamophobia, the Muslim community questions the delay and what the role can achieve.

title.children: 'We don't believe in a hierarchy of racism': Why some Muslim leaders say an Islamophobia envoy isn't necessary

image.altText: A man holding a red umbrella and two women walk past a black wall that reads Reserve Bank of Australia.

props.synopsis: The RBA will decide whether to hike or hold rates next Tuesday. The bank's new deputy governor has offered us some clues to which way they might go.

title.children: Will the Reserve Bank hike or hold rates next week? The new deputy governor has given us a few clues

image.altText: Primary aged school stduents with school logo green backpacks walk along a city street

props.synopsis: A major school funding agreement is being signed in Darwin, which could bring big changes for every public school in Australia and shape the next decade of schooling.

title.children: The number of teens finishing high school 'is going backwards'. A new funding agreement hopes to solve that

image.altText: An unidentified woman holds a newborn baby wearing a red jumper

props.synopsis: There are approximately 120 surrogate births per year in Australia, according to a mix of data captured by IVF clinics and surrogate advocates.

title.children: 'Because I don't have a uterus we don't get any Medicare': One family's remarkable surrogacy journey

image.altText: In the office, displeased female CEO of Asian ethnicity, scolding her male mixed-race employee.

props.synopsis: Constantly second guessing the decisions you make in the workplace? There's a chance that a certain management style might be the culprit.

title.children: How to break the pattern of micromanagement in the workplace

image.altText: A close up of Gretta Ray's posing for photographers at the ARIA awards

props.synopsis: The Australian singer says she is regaining her strength, but will need to return to hospital for heart surgery in the future.

title.children: Gretta Ray cancels shows to recover from rare heart disease

image.altText: A young woman holding a black and white photo of her mother.

props.synopsis: Romany Wake and Shakira Robertson used to be next door neighbours. Now they're trying to support each other after both their mothers were killed tragically in separate incidents.

title.children: 'I've just killed your mum': Romany Wake's father committed murder, then told her to call triple-0

image.altText: Two men in rain jackets, walk with a woman who is carrying a child through the mud.

props.synopsis: Local authorities say rescue operations have been hampered after a main bridge collapsed in the region.

title.children: Landslides in India's Kerala state kill at least 108 and injure more than 120

image.altText: A multi storey building construction site situated on a street corner block with branded red text across the fence

props.synopsis: A troubled Perth building company with more than 230 unfinished homes on its books fails to have its building contractor registration renewed, leaving customers facing further uncertainty.

title.children: Embattled Perth builder Nicheliving has registration revoked, leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A hand is shown parting venetian blinds to enable a person to look out a window.

props.synopsis: For years, frontline workers combating domestic violence in the Northern Territory have been pleading for more funding. Weeks out from an NT election, they've been promised $180 million.

title.children: 'Bare minimum': Is a bipartisan commitment of $180m enough to combat the NT's high DV rates?

image.altText: Defence Chief David Johnston pictured in his military attire outside a house.

props.synopsis: New Australian Defence Force Chief David Johnston talks down the prospect of war with China, but warns the ADF must expand its workforce.

title.children: New ADF chief says war with China not 'imminent' but military ready to support region

image.altText: A vision-impaired man named Brian Zaw wears dark glasses and holds a cane.

props.synopsis: Brian Zaw is legally blind and his family were forced to flee Myanmar during the military coup in 2021. He's now working tirelessly from Australia to help people with disabilities still in the war-torn nation.

title.children: Fighting for disability rights in Myanmar almost cost Brian his life, but he's still fighting from afar
